name: Trivial Stuff 4 Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what movie did Glenn Close narrate the story from her sickbed?
questions.explanation:
Reversal of Fortune.

	This 1990 true-crime movie starred Glenn Close as Sonny Von Bulow and Jeremy Irons as Klaus Von Bulow.  The reason Glenn Close narrated the story from her sickbed was because she was in a permanent coma.  Jeremy Irons won an Academy Award for Best Actor.

questions.text: Who was the first winner of the Patsy Award in 1950?
questions.explanation:
Francis the Talking Mule.

	The animal equivalent of the "Oscars," the Patsy award (Picture Animal Top Star of the Year) was presented by Hollywood's office of the American Humane Association to human trained animal performers for noteworthy performances in TV and movies between 1951 and 1986.

questions.text: In what movie did Leslie Caron play a young orphan girl that Fred Astaire's character falls in love with?
questions.explanation:
Daddy Longlegs.

	Fred Astaire starred as a millionaire who falls in love with a young orphaned girl played by Leslie Caron in this 1955 musical.

questions.text: What country was artist Eduard Munch from?
questions.explanation:
Norway.

	Artist Eduard Munch is most famous for his painting "The Scream".

questions.text: What is Dendrophobia the fear of ?
questions.explanation:
Trees.

	The fear of dentists (a more common fear then Dendrophobia) is Dentophobia.  The fear of teeth is Odontophobia and the fear of decay is Septophobia.

questions.text: Which of these U.S. Presidents had the shortest term?
questions.explanation:
William Harrison.

	The ninth President of the United States, William Henry Harrison died about one month into his term in 1841.  Harrison was also the first to die during his presidency.

One-billionth of a second.

	A nanosecond is over even before you can say it.

questions.text: What was the first movie directed by Alfred Hitchcock to be filmed in color?
questions.explanation:
Rope.

	Alfred Hitchcock directed and produced the movie "Rope" which was released in 1948 and starred James Stewart.

questions.correct: The girl in "Yes, Virginia there is a Santa Claus"
options: The girl in Billy Joel's song "Only the Good Die Young"
The founder of the girl scouts
questions.explanation:
The girl in "Yes, Virginia there is a Santa Claus".

	Virginia O'Hanlon was eight years old when she wrote the New York Sun asking if there was a Santa Claus.  The reply and editoral called, "Yes, Virginia there is a Santa Claus" is still seen in print during Christmas time.

questions.text: 'West Egg' was the town where Jay Gatsby lived in "The Great Gatsby".
questions.explanation:
True.

	"The Great Gatsby" written by F. Scott Fitzgerald in 1925.
